intro: Cecropia reticulata, commonly known as the net-veined cecropia, is a tropical tree belonging to the Euphorbiaceae family. It is characterized by its large, palmate leaves with a distinctive net-like venation pattern. The plant typically grows in humid, lowland forests across Central and South America. Its bark is smooth and often has a reddish or grayish hue. Cecropia reticulata is also known for its rapid growth and ability to thrive in disturbed habitats.
